sect1.title: Giving Feedback
sect1.para: We welcome feedback for and contributions to this documentation. There are several channels for this:

listitem.para: For services and support options available for your product, see .
To open a service request, you need a &suse; subscription registered at &scc;. Go to , log in, and click Create New.
Report issues with the documentation at . Reporting issues requires a Bugzilla account.

To simplify this process, you can use the Report Documentation Bug links next to headlines in the HTML version of this document. These preselect the right product and category in Bugzilla and add a link to the current section. You can start typing your bug report right away.

To contribute to this documentation, use the Edit Source links next to headlines in the HTML version of this document. They take you to the source code on GitHub, where you can open a pull request. Contributing requires a GitHub account.
For more information about the documentation environment used for this documentation, see the repository's README at .

You can also report errors and send feedback concerning the documentation to doc-team@suse.com. Include the document title, the product version, and the publication date of the document. Additionally, include the relevant section number and title (or provide the URL) and provide a concise description of the problem.

Since &productname; for Windows is still in Beta, we would like to remind you that all SUSE Beta Software is bound by the &suse; Beta EULA, which you can read at: As such, &suse; can only provide support via our Beta Program Channel.
To open a bug report, please follow the following instructions: .

For enhancement requests or any other inquiries, please do not hesitate to contact us via our storage-beta Public Beta Mailing list: . For any private requests, please contact us directly via beta-programs@lists.suse.com.
